description:
## Overview
[github.com/rancher/rancher/server](https://rancher.com) is a project that provides a container management platform built for organizations that deploy containers in production.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF). It allows an exploiter to gain access to clusters managed by Rancher. The attack requires a victim to be logged into a Rancher server, and then to access a third-party site hosted by the exploiter. The exploiter is then able to execute commands against the victims clusters Kubernetes API with the permissions and identity of the victim.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/rancher/rancher/server` to version 2.0.16, 2.1.11, 2.2.5 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/rancher/rancher/commit/0ddffe484adccb9e37d9432e8e625d8ebbfb0088)
- [Rancher Forums](https://forums.rancher.com/c/announcements)
- [Rancher Version Release](https://forums.rancher.com/t/rancher-release-v2-2-5-addresses-rancher-cve-2019-13209/14801)
title: Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF)

description:
## Overview
[`github.com/gogs/gogs/routes/user`](https://github.com/gogs/gogs) is a painless self-hosted Git service.

Affected versions of the package are vulnerable to Open Redirect. An attacker could redirect users to arbitrary websites and conduct phishing attacks via an initial `/\` substring in the user/login `redirect_to` parameter.

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/gogs/gogs/routes/user` to version 0.12 or higher.

## References
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/gogs/gogs/pull/5365)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/gogs/gogs/issues/5364)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gogs/gogs/commit/1f247cf8139cb483276cd8dd06385a800ce9d4b2)
title: Open Redirect

description:
## Overview
[github.com/concourse/concourse/skymarshal/skyserver](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/concourse/concourse/skymarshal/skyserver?tab=overview) is a module of Concourse CI/CD automation system.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Open Redirect. It allows redirects to untrusted websites in its login flow. A remote unauthenticated attacker could convince a user to click on a link using the OAuth redirect link with an untrusted website and gain access to that users access token in Concourse. (This issue is similar to, but distinct from, CVE-2018-15798.)
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/concourse/concourse/skymarshal/skyserver` to version 5.2.8, 5.5.10, 5.7.2, 5.8.1 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/concourse/concourse/commit/d058b7cca60a393abdea90fed38a0c6714256e4f)
- [Pivotal Security Advisory](https://pivotal.io/security/cve-2020-5409)
- [VMWare Vulnerability Report](https://tanzu.vmware.com/security/cve-2018-15798)
title: Open Redirect

description:
## Overview
[github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pkg/kafka/auth](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger) is a distributed tracing platform.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure. Sensitive information is written to a log file when the Kafka data store is used. This flaw allows an attacker with access to the containers log file to discover the Kafka credentials.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pkg/kafka/auth` to version 1.18.1 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/commit/360c38bec3f9718ebba7ddbf0b409b05995f3ace)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1838401)
title: Information Exposure

description:
## Overview
[github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pkg/volume/quobyte](https://pkg.go.dev/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/volume/quobyte?tab=doc) is a contains the internal representation of Quobyte volumes.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF). There exists a Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in kube-controller-manager that allows certain authorized users to leak up to 500 bytes of arbitrary information from unprotected endpoints within the masters host network (such as link-local or loopback services).

An attacker with permissions to create a pod with certain built-in Volume types (GlusterFS, Quobyte, StorageOS, ScaleIO) or permissions to create a StorageClass can cause kube-controller-manager to make GET requests or POST requests without an attacker controlled request body from the masters host network.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pkg/volume/quobyte` to version 1.18.1, 1.17.4, 1.16.9, 1.15.12 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/91542)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/89794)
title: Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF)

description:
## Overview
[gobot.io/x/gobot/platforms/mqtt](https://github.com/hybridgroup/gobot) is a Golang framework for robotics, drones, and the Internet of Things (IoT).

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insecure Defaults. It skipped verification of root CA certificates by using default `InsecureSkipVerify`.
## Remediation
Upgrade `gobot.io/x/gobot/platforms/mqtt` to version 1.13.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/hybridgroup/gobot/commit/c1aa4f867846da4669ecf3bc3318bd96b7ee6f3f)
- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/hybridgroup/gobot/releases/tag/v1.13.0)
title: Insecure Defaults

description:
## Overview
[github.com/uadmin/uadmin](https://github.com/uadmin) is a fully loaded web framework for Golang.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to SQL Injection. Multiple SQL Injection vulnerabilities exist within `uadmin` API handlers.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/uadmin/uadmin` to version 0.5.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/uadmin/uadmin/commit/a28a44f966417233bff36f96994f71d3911dddc2)
- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/uadmin/uadmin/releases/tag/v0.5.0)
title: SQL Injection

description:
## Overview
[github.com/slackhq/nebula](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/slackhq/nebula?tab=doc) is a scalable overlay networking tool with a focus on performance, simplicity and security.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Path Traversal. Slack Nebula through 1.1.0 contains a relative path vulnerability that allows a low-privileged attacker to execute code in the context of the root user via tun_darwin.go or tun_windows.go. A user can also use Nebula to execute arbitrary code in the users own context, e.g., for user-level persistence or to bypass security controls. NOTE: the vendor states that this requires a high degree of access and other preconditions that are tough to achieve.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/slackhq/nebula` to version 1.2.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/slackhq/nebula/pull/191)
- [PWN3D Advisory](http://www.pwn3d.org/posts/7918501-slack-nebula-relative-path-bug-bounty-disclosure)
title: Path Traversal

description:
## Overview

[github.com/hashicorp/consul/agent/consul](https://www.consul.io/) is a distributed, highly available, and data center aware solution to connect and configure applications across dynamic, distributed infrastructure.


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS).
Unbounded resource usage, triggered by the establishment of many unauthenticated HTTP or RPC connections, may generate excessive load and/or crash the server.

## Details


## Remediation

Upgrade `github.com/hashicorp/consul/agent/consul` to version 1.6.3 or higher.


## References

- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/commit/b788f729e9653d4a81691cbccedca2a2ac06f5ea)

- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/issues/7159)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/oragono/oragono/irc](https://github.com/oragono/oragono) is a modern, experimental IRC server written in Go.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) via the `ReadLine` function.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/oragono/oragono/irc` to version 2.3.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/oragono/oragono/pull/1226)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)
